titleStmt.title: Paul Peart, Gent. vpon the later nine Worthies.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Paul Peart, Gent. vpon the later nine Worthies.

monogr.title: The nine English worthies: or, Famous and worthy princes of England : being all of one name; beginning with King Henrie the first, and concluding with Prince Henry, eldest sonne to our Soueraigne Lord the King
monogr.author: Fletcher, Robert, purveyor of carriages to Queen Elizabeth

div.head: Paul Peart, Gent. vpon the later nine Worthies.

lg.l: TO make those Worthies liue againe.
Which long agoe were lapt in Lead,
Is worthy praise for taken paine,
To him that raiseth from the dead
Such Princes as in time possest
The Regal Scepter, Crowne and Globe,
And in their Tumbs haue taken rest,
That once did weare a kingly Robe,
Now to appeare on princely Stage,
And to resigne a princely power,
Vnto a Prince whose tender age
IEHOVA blesse, and grant each hower
Him to attend the royall hest,
He then from heauen shall be blest,
Nor dare proud Fortune euer frowne
On him that vertuously doth liue,
To whom eight HENRIES honour giue.
